remarks: A function mapping an argument to either a value of a finitely supported function or zero is finitely supported.  (Contributed by AV, 6-Jun-2019.)
statement:
fsuppmptif.f $e |- ( ph -> F : A --> B ) $.
fsuppmptif.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. V ) $.
fsuppmptif.z $e |- ( ph -> Z e. W ) $.
fsuppmptif.s $e |- ( ph -> F finSupp Z ) $.
fsuppmptif $p |- ( ph -> ( k e. A |-> if ( k e. D , ( F ` k ) , Z ) ) finSupp Z ) $.
$d A k $.
$d F k $.
$d Z k $.
$d k ph $.
